extendedIngredients.name: crystallized ginger
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup minced crystallized ginger (not in syrup)

extendedIngredients.name: sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup sugar, plus extra for sprinkling

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 pound (3 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature

recipes.title: Ginger Shortbread

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco are my top picks for Cookies. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.                          In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the butter and 1 cup of sugar on medium-low speed, just until they are combined. (Dont whip!) Add the vanilla and 2 teaspoons water and mix until combined. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour and salt. With the mixer on low, slowly add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until the dough starts to come together. Add the ginger, then dump onto a surface generously dusted with flour and shape into a flat disk. Wrap in plastic and chill for 30 minutes.                          Roll the dough 3/8 inch thick and cut circles with a 2 3/4-inch plain round cookie cutter. Place the cookies on an ungreased baking sheet and sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the edges start to brown.                          Cool to room temperature and serve.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the butter and 1 cup of sugar on medium-low speed, just until they are combined. (Dont whip!)

Add the vanilla and 2 teaspoons water and mix until combined. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour and salt. With the mixer on low, slowly add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until the dough starts to come together.
Add the ginger, then dump onto a surface generously dusted with flour and shape into a flat disk. Wrap in plastic and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll the dough 3/8 inch thick and cut circles with a 2 3/4-inch plain round cookie cutter.
Place the cookies on an ungreased baking sheet and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the edges start to brown.
Cool to room temperature and serve.
